# Introduction

For example, you can make enlarge-able plots:

```{r echo=FALSE}
# knitr::opts_knit$set(child = TRUE)
set.seed(1)
```

## Graphical relationship
```{r}
library(rmdpartials)
x <- rnorm(100)
y <- x + rnorm(100) + 0.5 * x^2
enlarge_plot(plot(x, y), large_plot = plot(x, y), plot_name = "myplot")
```

## Regression
```{r}
reg <- lm(y ~ x)
regression_diagnostics(reg)
```

## Predict what happens when you join two data frames

```{r}
options(knitr.duplicate.label = 'allow')

library(dplyr)
DT::datatable(band_members)
```

```{r}
join_sets(band_members, band_instruments)
```
